intro: Scheelea quadrisulcata, commonly known as the four-ribbed fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive fronds that have four prominent ribs running along their length. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests and rocky areas. Its spores are produced on the underside of the fronds in clusters called sori. Scheelea quadrisulcata is valued for its ornamental appearance and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
